comment._content:
Thomas R. Marshall, victorious candidate for Vice President on the Democratic ticket (with Woodrow Wilson), in 1912.

"What this country needs is a good five-cent cigar."

comment.author: 8716770@N08
comment._content: His wife is Lois Kimsey Marshall en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_R._Marshall

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Lois Irene Kimsey Marshall (born Lois Irene Kimsey; May 9, 1873 — January 6, 1958) was the wife of Thomas R. Marshall, who served as the 28th Vice President of the United States from 1913 to 1921. During her husband's tenure she held the unofficial position of the Second Lady of the United States. She served also as First Lady of Indiana during her husband's Governorship (1909–1913). en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lois_Irene_Marshall

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: Thanks Wystan, LucyGraceBarber, & Richard Arthur Norton, we'll update the records with their full name. Since he was only governor until the beginning of 1913, I'll ask to adjust the date range also.
